This is not acceptable to us," Elangovan claimed.Hindi imposition debate was reignited when Amit Shah on Thursday said that Hindi should be accepted as an alternative to English, not to local languages.When Indians who speak different languages communicate with each other, it should be in “the language of India”, a statement issued by the Union Home Ministry quoted Amit Shah as saying.Although the debate is on Hindi replacing English as a second language, AIADMK spokesperson Kovai Sathyan has stated that Hindi cannot replace any regional language."For each person, their language is dearer and this statement of Hindi replacing any of the regional languages is not going to happen," Sathyan said.
Author: Akshaya Nath

Headline: Eyes on 2024 polls, Rahul Gandhi calls on Opposition to unite against RSS, BJP
Entire_News: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that opposition parties must unite to fight the BJP and discussions are under way to determine the framework of a united front. The Congress leader made these remarks after meeting RJD leader Sharad Yadav."Opposition parties that are against RSS and Narendra Modi should come together. Discussions are ongoing on how they should come together, what should be the framework, and what has to be developed," he said.Talking about India's present economic situation, Rahul Gandhi said on Friday, "You can't imagine India's economic situation and job condition. Never in your life would you have seen what was coming next. The employment structure of this country, its backbone, is broken. Small and medium businesses, small shopkeepers, and the informal sector are our backbone.""Economists and bureaucrats make their plans by looking at other nations. The PM says we've got to become like them. It can't be done like that. First, we have to realise who we are and what's happening here. They've broken the backbone. Terrifying results will come in the next 3-4 years," he said.READ | Congress can very well challenge BJP in 2024, says Prashant KishorRahul Gandhi accused the BJP government of "spreading hatred and dividing the country"."Today, the country is in a very bad situation. Hatred is being spread and the country is being divided. We have to bring the nation together and walk on the path of brotherhood, which has been a part of our history," he said.Speaking about the ongoing crisis between Russia and Ukraine, Rahul Gandhi said, "Russia says that they don't accept the territoriality of Ukraine, they don't consider the Donetsk and Luhansk regions part of Ukraine. Russia attacked Ukraine on that basis. What is the aim? Breaking the alliance of Nato-Ukraine-US," said Rahul Gandhi."China is applying the same principle to India. China is saying that Ladakh and Arunachal Pradesh are not yours [India's] and they have deployed their troops there. The government is ignoring this. But we have a model [Russia-Ukraine]. That model can be applied here too," Rahul Gandhi added.READ | Who is actually winning the Russia-Ukraine war?READ | 'Country needs him': 78-year-old woman transfers all her property in Rahul Gandhi's name
Author: Supriya Bhardwaj

Headline: Amit Shah bats for Hindi as alternative to English, Opposition cries 'imposition’
Entire_News: Hindi should be accepted as an alternative to English and not to local languages, Union Home minister Amit Shah said on Friday. He made the remarks during the 37th meeting of the Parliamentary Official Language Committee in New Delhi.As per a statement issued by the Press Information Bureau (PIB), the Union Home minister suggested to the committee that it is time to carry out a revision of the Hindi dictionary. He even mentioned that 70 per cent of the Union Cabinet's agenda is now prepared in Hindi.Union Home minister Amit Shah also stressed the need for "elementary knowledge of Hindi for students up to 9th class" and "more attention to Hindi teaching examinations".READ: We don’t oppose Hindi, we oppose Hindi imposition, says Tamil Nadu CM Stalin"Time has come to make the Official Language an important part of the unity of the country. When people from states which speak other languages communicate with each other, it should be in the language of India."Unless we make Hindi flexible by accepting words from other local languages, it will not be promoted," the Union Home minister said.The statements have drawn sharp reactions from opposition parties, including the Congress, Shiv Sena, DMK and Trinamool Congress (TMC).Reacting to Union Home minister Amit Shah's remarks, Congress leader and former Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah said in a tweet, "As a Kannadiga, I take strong offence to @HMOIndia @AmitShah's comment on Official language & medium of communication. Hindi is not our National Language & we will never let it to be."History clearly suggests that any attempt to impose Hindi in other States have not gone well.We take pride in Kannada identity & we believe that Karnataka, as our poet Laureate Kuvempu said, is the daughter of Bharata #IndiaAgainstHindiImpositionKunal Ghosh, a spokesperson for the TMC, said, "We respect Hindi but we are opposing the imposition of Hindi. English is used internationally, a status quo should be maintained by the government on the issue of language."India has various states with various languages. Amit Shah needs to rethink what he has said. Rather than imposing Hindi as the national language, why doesn't the central government do something and reduce the prices of petrol and diesel?"Speaking on the issue, Shiv Sena leader Manisha Kayande said, "There seems to be an agenda to lessen the value of regional languages and parties in what Amit Shah has said.""We want English as an alternative to Hindi. All non- Hindi states want English as an alternative to Hindi. They say they want Hindi as an alternative to English, which is not good for states like Tamil Nadu. We have a language that is much older than Hindi... Tamil [language] has a history that leads back to 3,000 or more years. Hindi is a mixture of Sanskrit, Urdu and various other languages. This is not acceptable to us," said DMK MP TKS Elangovan.Interestingly, opposition parties are not the only ones who have taken offence to the Union Home minister's remarks.Kovai Sathyan, a spokesperson for AIADMK which is a part of the BJP-led NDA, said on the issue, "Hindi cannot replace any regional language and for every person, their language is dearer and this statement of Hindi replacing any of the regional languages is not going to happen."(With inputs by Akshaya Nath, Suryagni Roy, Pankaj Upadhyay, Amit Bhardwaj)
Author: Kamaljit Kaur Sandhu

Headline: Temperature shoots past 42 degrees Celsius in Rajasthan’s Fatehpur; no respite ahead
Entire_News: As parts of the country continue to reel under a severe heatwave, the maximum temperature rose by one degree to 42.7 degrees Celsius in Rajasthan's Fatehpur on Friday. This is the first time in three years that the first week of April recorded a temperature of 42.7 degrees Celsius.Citing no respite in the coming days, the weather officials have predicted that the mercury may reach 46 degrees by April-end.The weather is likely to remain dry till April 15, said Radheshyam Sharma, director of Jaipur Meteorological Department, adding that heatwave conditions are likely across the state, including Shekhawati.As per the prediction by the India Meteorological Department (IMD), heat wave spell is likely to continue over Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana-Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Vidarbha, Bihar and Jharkhand during the next 5 days.Heat Wave Spell likely to continue over Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana-Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Vidarbha, Bihar and Jharkhand during next 5 days pic.twitter.com/mBVQmjswRIOn Friday, the maximum temperature at Fatehpur Agricultural Research Center rose by one degree to 42.7 degrees. It was for the first time since 2019 that the mercury reached 42.7 degrees in the first week of April.As per experts, heatwave is expected to intensify in the last week of April. Owing to the heatwave conditions, the mercury may reach 46 degrees by the last week of April, said Fatehpur Agricultural Research Senior Scientist Dr KC Verma.(With inputs from Rakesh Gurjar)READ MORE| Gujarat: Mercury rises to 45 degrees Celsius in Kutch’s Kandla; heatwave likely till April 10
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: 3 run over by train while taking selfie on railway tracks in Tamil Nadu
Entire_News: Three adults were run over by a train while attempting to take a selfie video on railway tracks in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu. They were identified as Prakash (17), Mohan (17) and Ashok Kumar (24).The adults were residents of Chettipunniyam area near the Singaperumal temple. Prakash, Mohan and Kumar had been regularly posting videos taken on railway tracks and were planning to do the same when tragedy struck.They were standing on the railway track and recording video when they got run over by an express train from Chennai Tambaram heading to Villupuram.Upon receiving the information about the incident, the Railway Police arrived at the scene, recovered the bodies of the trio, and sent them to Chengalpattu Government Hospital for autopsy.
Author: Akshaya Nath

Headline: Maharashtra govt to purchase power from private players
Entire_News: The power demand is at its peak in Maharashtra as the mercury is rising day by day. The state government on Friday decided to buy power from private players. State energy minister Nitin Raut said that the current demand for electricity is 28,700 MW and could go up to 30,000 in June. At present, there is a shortfall of 1,500 MW in power demand and supply.The issue was discussed in the cabinet meeting to ensure that there is no load shedding in the state and 24 hours power supply. The state cabinet has approved the purchase of electricity. It will be available at a lower rate than the center rates.This decision will cost Rs 100 to Rs 150 crore rupees. Last year, the expenditure was Rs 192 crore.Raut said authorities are working everywhere in the country to get coal. The country's coal minister and energy department are working together with us.Coal reserves, on the other hand, are declining as demand for electricity increases. Sometimes railway tracks are not available for coal. Only 17 TMC of water is available in Koyna. Electricity costs ten to twelve rupees. But now there is no electricity in the market. In Gujarat, power is cut off one day a week, Raut said.Raut said that the state had signed an agreement with the company for 700 MW at Rs 5 per unit.Energy Minister Nitin Raut added said that the heat wave is in the state, due to which the transformers are failing due to rising heat in it. Now, when there is a power crisis, it has to be taken from private companies.Nitin Raut said that the extra power that is needed now has to be taken from private companies during the power crisis. Now there is a shortage of coal.The contract was signed in 2007 at a cost of three and a half rupees. The Center has set a rate of Rs 12. "You can buy 50 percent more than that," Raut said.
Author: Mustafa Shaikh

Headline: Uttar Pradesh govt to provide over 9 lakh tabs & smartphones to youths
Entire_News: The Yogi Adityanath government in Uttar Pradesh has announced to distribute a total of 9.74 lakh tablets and smartphones across the state. The Department of Information Technology has already been told to include it in its 100-day action plan, officials said on Friday.Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, the education of the youth was badly affected over the last two years as they were unable to go to schools and colleges.To ensure that the education of the youth is not hindered, the government started online education, but the youth’s unfamiliarity with modern technology was a major obstacle in the way.The BJP in its Sankalp Patra has set a target of giving tablets and smartphones to 2 crore youth to make them technologically capable.In this regard, the Information Technology Department of the State Government has included giving 9.74 lakh tablets and smartphones to the youth in its 100-day action plan.The state government has already started preparations. The state government has directed the officers of the department to complete all the necessary action at the earliest and to provide tablets and smartphones to the youth within the stipulated time.The officials have also been asked to identify the eligible students/beneficiaries for tablets and smartphones from each district.

Headline: Sharad Pawar did nothing: MSRTC workers protest outside NCP chief’s Mumbai home
Entire_News: Over a 100 workers of the Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), on strike over their demand of the merger of the MSRTC with the state government, protested outside Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai this afternoon, shouting slogans against the veteran politician, accusing him of not doing anything to resolve their issues.The workers outside 'Silver Oak' - Pawar’s residence in south Mumbai - tried to break through the security barricades even as Supriya Sule tried to pacify them. Some sat on the road outside Silver Oak despite heavy police deployment while a few threw their shoes at the politician’s house.This comes a day after the Bombay High Court asked the striking workers to resume duty by April 22. Following the court order, state Transport Minister Anil Parab assured that no action would be taken against workers who report to work within the High Court deadline.Thousands of MSRTC workers have been protesting since November, demanding that they be treated at par with the state government employees.Also Read: | Bombay HC asks protesting Maharashtra road transport employees to resume duty“Around 120 MSRTC employees have died by suicide during the strike. They have been murdered by the state policy. We are firm in our demand for a merger. NCP chief Sharad Pawar has not done anything to resolve the issue," an agitating employee of the MSRTC told news agency PTI.“We respect the Bombay High Court’s decision. But we were discussing the issues with the state government which has been elected by the people. This elected government did nothing for us. The Chanakya (political mastermind) behind this government - Sharad Pawar - is also responsible for our losses,” said another worker, reported PTI.Sharad Pawar is considered to be the chief architect of the tri-party Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, which is a coalition of the Shiv Sena, the NCP and the Congress.Also Read: | All MSRTC bus depots remain shut, but some workshop employees resume work
Author: Mustafa Shaikh

Headline: Gorakhnath temple attacker can be part of larger conspiracy hatched by ‘virtual plotters’: Former Lt Gen
Entire_News: A man wielding a sickle and chasing cops outside the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh sent shockwaves through the country. The attack has striking similarities with the terror modules of Hezbollah and HAMAS of the middle-east, according to experts, who say that such terror attacks, using knifes, are common in Israel.However, Lieutenant General Abhay Krishna (Retd.), former General Officer Commanding-in-Chief of the southwestern, eastern and central commands of the Indian Army, says that it is too early to trace this attack back to such modules in the middle-east. It also cannot be ruled out as a future trend by terrorist organizations, he added.“There may be a possibility that the individual may have been radicalised or recruited online, like digital recruitment done by ISIS or Hezbollah. The accused, Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, could be a potential target of these terrorist organisations for several reasons. Recruits termed as “virtual entrepreneurs” or “virtual plotters” are recruited online by terrorist organisations through social media platforms and are incited, funded and possibly trained remotely for terror acts,” Lt Gen Krishna told India Today TV.Also Read: | Gorakhnath temple attacker was honey-trapped into aiding IS, say police“There might be a possibility that other vulnerable and educated youths are also being recruited online by terrorist organisations to carry out attacks on other possible targets similar to what is being done by Hezbollah in Israel. After further facts and linkages are brought to the fore by investigating agencies and after a follow-up trend of such incidents, more convincing opinions could be formed. As of now, it has come to light in the preliminary reports that the culprit was influenced by banned Islamic preacher Zakir Naik and has a possible link to ISIS. This incident could be one of the stray incidents in the wake of an outburst of one of the communities on the Hijab issue and “The Kashmir Files”,” he added.The background of the attacker stunned investigators that an IIT graduate, with a brilliant mind, can be so radicalised.“An educated person is the most vulnerable to mental steering if explained with logic or if his perspective about things, including any ideology, is influenced. Therefore, the doctrine followed to get these vulnerable and educated young people may be to first identify them, then use social media platforms to establish contact with such individuals, followed by forging of nascent relationships and religious indoctrination,” the army man said.Also Read: | UP govt terms attack on cops at Gorakhnath temple an 'act of terror'“Then comes communication with prospective recruits via email and sending instructions on how to use encrypted communication platforms, including encrypted mail and instructions to minimise detection. A sleeper cell is formed by recruiting trusted and committed individuals. Potential targets, with political and religious prominence, are put under surveillance. One can presume that the Gorakhnath temple was chosen because the chief minister of Uttar Pradesh is also the chief priest of the temple and because of the role he played in the Ram Mandir case. A significant sum of money is also promised to online recruits and transferred beforehand or after committing the terror act,” he added.The attack also raised questions about the training of the policemen, especially at constable levels, who are deployed at such crucial places.“The police should incorporate adequate expertise, infrastructure and training of its personnel in the cyber and information warfare domain to tackle such attackers. Close coordination with sister intelligence agencies is also a must to thwart the online recruitment activities of terrorist organisations through social media platforms. Therefore, one can assume that presently the Indian police forces do not appear to be adequately trained to handle such violence due to inappropriate equipment, procedures and training. There is also a supposed communication gap and non-synergy among organisations dealing with terrorism,” Lt. Gen Krishna (Retd.) said.“Moreover, such attacks are bound to succeed initially due to the surprise factor. However, the overall damage remains restricted due to the use of crude weapons. India’s ‘no free gun’ policy will definitely help in keeping such incidents localised and restrict the scale of damage,” he added.Also Read: | Gorakhnath temple attacker says he was angry over 'CAA, NRC, atrocities against Muslims'
Author: Abhishek Anand

Headline: BJP accuses TMC of vandalising its campaign posters ahead of Ballygunge by-election
Entire_News: BJP strongly condemned the ruling TMC for allegedly vandalising flexes and hoardings in Ballygunge area in Kolkata ahead of bypolls.BJP candidate Keya Ghosh on Friday took to Twitter to share some pictures of vandalism saying, “This is the level of tolerance of TMC in Ballygunge. Flex and hoardings are being torn.”This is the level of "tolerance" of TMC in Ballygunge. Flex and hoarding are being torn, Party flags are thrown away ! Shame on you TMC !@ECISVEEP #Vote4BJP #Keya4Ballygunge pic.twitter.com/XnEpyn1dT4She also alleged that her party flags were thrown away.This alleged vandalism happened on Friday morning . Leader of Opposition (LOP) Subhendu Adhikari is scheduled to campaign for Keya Ghosh today.On Thursday, the Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee campaigned for party colleague Babul Supriyo who is contesting for West Bengal's Ballygunge assembly seat in a by-election to be held on April 12.READ | West Bengal bypolls: CPI(M) fields Saira Shah Halim from Ballygunge Assembly seat
Author: Rittick Mondal

Headline: EC transfers 2 police officers ahead of Asansol bypolls in West Bengal
Entire_News: The Election Commission, on Friday, ordered the transfer of two police officers of Asansol Durgapur Police commissionerate, four days ahead of the bypolls for Asansol's Lok Sabha seat.The inspector in-charge of Asansol South police station, Abhijit Chatterjee and Sanjiv De of Jamuria Police station have been transferred out.Three names have been sought by the EC from the state to replace the officers.Asansol goes to polls for the Asansol Lok Sabha seat after former MP, Babul Supriyo left the seat after leaving the BJP. Agnimitra Paul, BJP MLA of Asansol South has been rendered the task of taking on Shatrughan Sinha, who is fighting on a TMC ticket.
Author: Suryagni Roy

Headline: India tests Solid Fuel Ducted Ramjet technology missile
Entire_News: A flight trial of Solid Fuel Ducted Ramjet (SFDR) booster was conducted from the Integrated Test Range (ITR) in Chandipur today at around 10:30 am. The test successfully demonstrated the reliable functioning of all critical components involved in the complex missile system and met all the mission objectives.SFDR-based propulsion enables the missile to intercept aerial threats at very long ranges at supersonic speeds.The performance of the system has been confirmed from the data captured by a number of Range instruments like Telemetry, Radar and Electro-Optical Tracking Systems (EOTS) deployed by ITR.SFDR has been developed by Defence Research and Development Laboratory (DRDL), Hyderabad in collaboration with other DRDO laboratories such as RCI, Hyderabad and HEMRL, Pune.Defence Minister Rajnath Singh congratulated DRDO for the successful trial of SFDR and said that this is an important milestone towards the development of critical missile technologies in the country.READ MORE | Aakar Patel barred from leaving India for now, court to hear CBI lookout notice matter on April 12
Author: author not available

Headline: Thane man 'cheats' woman into marriage by not disclosing homosexuality
Entire_News: A sessions court in Thane, Maharashtra, rejected the anticipatory bail plea of a man who allegedly cheated a woman by not disclosing his sexual orientation before marriage.The man and the woman had met through an online portal. After a few meetings, they decided to get married after their respective families agreed to it.The marriage was solemnised on November 20, 2021. However, three months after the marriage, the two started to live separately.
Author: Vidya

Headline: Rivals call Tejashwi Yadav 'failure in politics' after Bihar council poll debacle
Entire_News: Tejashwi Yadav has come under attack from rival parties after Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) performed disastrously, winning just six out of 23 seats it contested in the just-concluded biennial elections to the 24 Legislative Council seats from the urban local bodies and Panchayati Raj Institutions in the state on Thursday.Former Bihar Chief Minister Jitan Ram Manjhi's Hindustani Aawam Morcha has called Tejashwi 'a complete failure in politics and demanded that Lalu Prasad hands over the reins of the party to his elder brother Tej Pratap Yadav.'Hindustani Awam Morcha spokesperson Danish Rizwan said Tejashwi failed to clear Class 10 exams, then he failed as a cricketer and now also proved to be a failure in politics.Rizwan said Lalu Prasad should instead send Tejashwi Yadav to Rajya Sabha so that he could do politics through the back door and instead hand over the command of the party to Tej Pratap."NDA's victory in the Legislative Council Elections has once again proved that Tejashwi was a complete failure in politics. The RJD has lost all the elections that it has fought under the leadership of Tejashwi Yadav. Lalu should send him to Rajya Sabha and make Tej Pratap the head of the party if it wants to perform well in the future," Danish Rizwan said.
Author: Rohit Kumar Singh

Headline: Family of four killed in AC explosion in Karnataka's Vijayanagara district
Entire_News: Four members of a family, including a couple and their two children were killed due to an explosion in the Air Conditioner (AC) in Mariyammanahalli village in Karnataka’s Vijayanagara district.The incident occurred at around 12.40 AM on Friday.A preliminary probe revealed that the fire emanated after a gas leaked from AC vent, triggering an electric short circuit which further led to an explosion. The entire house was also gutted in fire.According to reports, the deceased have been identified as Venkat Prashanth (42), his wife D. Chandrakala (38), their son Advik (6) and daughter Prerana (8).Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter and are looking at if there were any loans or the family was under any kind of stress.READ MORE| Tamil Nadu couple awarded 4 death sentences for setting family members ablaze in their sleep
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: ED conducts searches in Delhi-NCR in NSE co-location scam
Entire_News: In connection with the co-location scam, the Enforcement Directorate conducted searches in 12-15 locations in Delhi-NCR on Friday.The ED conducted searches at various brokers' offices in Delhi and Gurugram.READ: NSE scam: The lady and the yogiThe case pertains to a co-location facility offered by the National Stock Exchange where brokers could place their servers within the stock exchange premises giving them faster access to the markets.It is alleged that some brokers in connivance with insiders abused the algorithm and the co-location facility to make windfall profits.The ED registered a case in the matter in 2018 under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.The CBI has been probing the scam since 2018 against a Delhi-based stockbroker but the central agency swung into action after a Sebi report showed alleged abuse of power by the then top brass of the NSE, officials have said.The CBI has already arrested former CEO of NSE Chitra Ramakrishnan and former Group Operating Officer of NSE Anand Subramanian.
Author: Divyesh Singh

Headline: BJP conspiring to separate Mumbai, says Sena leader Sanjay Raut
Entire_News: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has claimed that efforts are on to separate Mumbai city and bring it under central control. Raut claimed a lobby of builders was involved in it, along with a person from Varanasi.Although Raut refused to name the big builder, the Sena leader did say that efforts were being put together to defame the Sena and that BJP leader Kirit Somaiya was also a part of it.“I am saying this with full responsibility. I am a Shiv Sena leader and also a Member of Parliament. Efforts are on to separate Mumbai and soon a presentation will be given to the home minister as well. I am telling you now what conspiracy is being hatched. And now efforts will be made by BJP to defame the Shiv Sena,” said Raut.The Sena leader, who returned to Mumbai yesterday evening, made a scathing remark about BJP leader Kirit Somaiya.“He’s the enemy of Maharashtra and does work equivalent to Kasab (the terrorist). He’s not only involved in a big conspiracy but has cheated the nation of crores of rupees. His antics will not work. He’s a thief who’s looted money in the name of Vikrant (INS). And now that the FIR has been registered the truth will come out,” he said.On social media, Raut called Kirit Somaiya “Mahatma Somaiya” and asked him to give details of the money collected in the name of (INS) Vikrant.Also Read: Rs 11-crore property of Sanjay Raut's wife, 'friend' Pravin Raut attached by EDAlso Read: I have become more dangerous now, says Sanjay Raut after ED's action against wife, 'aide'
Author: Pankaj Upadhyay

Headline: CBI officer 'switched off phone' to avoid passing on court's order to airport authorities: Aakar Patel
Entire_News: Ex-Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel has alleged that the CBI's investigating officer had switched off his phone despite the court's order to communicate the revocation of the look-out circular against Patel to the immigration authorities.Patel’s lawyer Tanvir Mir on Friday, April 8, told a Delhi court: “At 10.30 when Patel went to the airport he was stopped again by the immigration authorities. We tried to contact the IO but he deliberately switched off his phone. The directive of the court was that the LOC is withdrawn immediately and communication sent to the officers concerned.”
Author: Aneesha Mathur

Headline: Fire at toothpaste factory in Sonipat, goods worth lakhs gutted
Entire_News: A major fire broke out at a toothpaste factory in Sonipat, Haryana, on Friday morning.The fire was reported at the Raghav Lifestyle Products factory located in the Kundli Industrial area.12 fire tenders were pressed into action and after several hours of efforts, the fire was brought under control.Goods worth lakhs were burnt to ashes. However, no injuries or casualties were reported.The cause of the fire is yet to be known.READ MORE: Pathankot: 3 killed, 1 injured after bike collides with tractor-trolley
Author: author not available

Headline: One killed, 18 injured in road accident in West Bengal’s Bankura
Entire_News: One person was killed while 18 others suffered injuries in a road accident in West Bengal's Bankura district in the early hours of Friday.The accident took place at around 3 AM on Friday when the victims were returning home from a fair in Deshuria in Gangajalghati.A total of 19 people were injured in the accident, according to local sources. It was when the car driver lost control that the car overturned near a culvert in the middle of Desuria-Kenduadihi on the Desuria-Ramharipur road, leaving 19 people injured.Later, those injured were taken to Amarkanan Rural Hospital, where the doctors declared one person dead. According to sources, the deceased has been identified as Bishu Bauri (32) of Jambedia village.While 18 people were taken to Bankura Sanmilani Medical College and Hospital for treatment, one of the injured has been shifted to Calcutta as his condition is stated to be critical.READ MORE| 5 killed in road accident in West Bengal’s East Burdwan district
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: DMK decided to raise property tax by such high percentage, says TN BJP MLA Vanathi Srinivasan
Entire_News: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Chennai, while protesting the rise in property taxes, said that it was the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) government’s decision to increase the property tax by such a high percentage.BJP MLA Vanathi Srinivasan said, “Only for the sake of convenience, they are putting the blame on the finance commission or the planning commission.”Participating in the protest against the hike in property tax across Tamil Nadu, the BJP MLA said, “The honourable house, along with the CM, had said that without an alternative, they are taking the decision to increase the property tax.”The BJP's Vanathi Srinivasan, who is the national president of the BJP Mahila Morcha, also pointed out that when the AIADMK government took a decision to increase the property tax during the last regime, MK Stalin had staged a demonstration and questioned if the proposal was for property tax, or for the value of the property itself.She further slammed the DMK government saying, “Now, on one hand, they are saying that they have created a new model in India. On the other hand, they have accepted their failure of not finding adequate resources for running the government. This is the present pathetic situation for Tamil Nadu.”Also Read: Property tax hike has hit TN people like a tsunami wave, says O Panneerselvam“The central government is giving various guidelines, while the state government is objecting to several of the guidelines given by the centre. Why are they following this? Only for the sake of convenience are they putting the blame on the finance commission or the planning commission,” said BJP MLA Vanathi Srinivasan.She also spoke about the funds for local bodies and the recently concluded urban local body polls. “The funds for the development of local bodies, etc. are stopped if the election is not done as per the guidelines of the finance commission and SC to ensure the strengthening of the local body's democracy.”“It is the SC guideline to not give funds to the local body if elections are held improperly,” she said.“The guideline is to properly notify the taxes, and neither the planning commission nor the Centre has asked for an increase of taxes by 100 or 150 percent. It was the state's decision to raise the taxes by such a high percentage,” said the BJP MLA.Also Read: Tamil Nadu govt hikes property tax, Palaniswami calls it 'gift by DMK' for recent poll win
Author: Akshaya Nath

Headline: MP: 16-year-old electrocuted while taking selfie atop train engine
Entire_News: A 16-year-old boy was electrocuted to death as he came in contact with a high tension electricity cable while taking a selfie atop a stationary train engine at Chhatarpur railway station in Madhya Pradesh, an official said on Friday.The incident took place on Thursday, the railway official said.“The boy, identified as Suhail Mansoori, got electrocuted while trying to take a selfie after climbing on a stationary train engine,” Chhatarpur railway station master Shubhank Patel said.The victim’s friend Ashraf said Mansoori went to the railway station in the morning, where he took out his mobile phone and climbed on a stationary railway engine to take a selfie when the tragedy occurred. “The victim tried to grab an overhead high tension electricity line, which was charged. He died while trying to take a selfie on his mobile phone,” Railway Protection Force (RPF) inspector Jitendra Kumar said.
Author: Press Trust of India

Headline: Gujarat: Two men enter sewer in search of gold dust, die of suffocation
Entire_News: Two workers died of suffocation after they entered a sewer in search of gold dust on Wednesday night in the Ambaji Road area of Surat, Gujarat.It was on Wednesday night, at around 1 PM that two unidentified workers, of the area, one by one, descended into a sewer to collect gold waste. However, it was when the first worker did not come out even after a long wait that the other went down to see him, only to find him dead.He then shouted out for help. Hearing the cries of the man, people reached the spot and further informed the fire department.The two men trapped inside the sewer were dead till the time they were taken out of the sewer. Doctors said the two men died after inhaling toxic gases, leading to suffocation.Locals informed that garbage pickers in the area usually collected gold jewellery powder from the gutter, which turned fatal.READ MORE| Pune: Three workers die of suffocation while cleaning septic tank; fourth dies during rescue attempt
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Bokaro: Bike thieves attack police with knives, sticks; three arrested
Entire_News: In a shocking incident reported from Jharkhand, a police team on an operation to arrest bike thieves was attacked with sticks and knives, leaving three cops injured.While three thieves have been arrested, the main attacker managed to slip away, for whom a search is underway.The incident took place in Bokaro where a combined police team of two areas was on the search for bike thieves.The stolen bike belonged to Inspector Pawan Kumar of Bokaro City Police Station, stolen from Sector 12.A combined team of Bokaro City Police Station and Sector 12 Police Station began their search for the stolen vehicle. The bike was spotted near Gayghat of Chas area and the cops started looking for the thieves riding it.....When the police spotted the miscreants, they started shouting in their local dialect, causing a mob to gather around the police officers.Taking advantage of the distraction, one of the three thieves attacked Pawan Kumar with a knife, after which the mob also laid their hands on the police officers.DSP Kuldeep Kumar said that Inspector Pawan Kumar of Bokaro City Police Station was attacked with a knife while Inspector Rajesh Yadav and Raman Kumar of Sector 12 Police Station were beaten with sticks.He also said that the three officers have been admitted to Bokaro General Hospital for treatment and are out of danger.READ| As fuel rates soar, fish prices jump in Kolkata | Check latest prices here
Author: Satyajeet Kumar

Headline: Birbhum burning direct fallout of TMC leader's killing: CBI
Entire_News: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in its report has suggested that the Birbhum arson case which led to the death of nine villagers was the “direct fallout” of the killing of TMC panchayat leader Bhadu Sheikh who was murdered in Bogtui village that very night.According to the report submitted by the CBI before the Calcutta High Court, the incident was an “outcome of the rivalry amongst the members of two groups in the village” and the burning of the houses was a “retaliatory plan”.
Author: Indrajit Kundu

Headline: Pune: Fire erupts in industrial unit in Pimpri Chinchwad, goods worth crores gutted
Entire_News: A major fire broke out in an industrial unit located in the Moshi area, adjacent to Pimpri-Chinchwad city in Pune on Thursday night.Goods worth crores were gutted to ashes as fire engulfed about 7 to 8 chemical companies located in the area.Upon receiving the information about the blaze, about 30 fire tenders of the local metropolitan corporation were rushed to the spot to douse the flames and after hours of effort the fire was brought under control.While chemical companies were gutted in fire, no human casualties have been reported in the accident. Meanwhile, the exact cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained.(With inputs from Sameer Sheikh)READ MORE| 8 injured after fire breaks out in scrap godown in Maharashtra’s Pimpri-Chinchwad
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Kerala Congress firm on demand to dismiss KV Thomas if he attends CPM party congress
Entire_News: The Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC) will accept nothing short of the expulsion of senior party leader KV Thomas, rather than giving him a mere suspension order, if he attends a seminar at the CPM party congress that is underway in Kannur.Meanwhile, KV Thomas arrived at Kannur on Friday morning and will definitely attend a seminar on the topic 'Centre-State Relations'. He will be attending the function even though Congress party high command forbade him from doing so a few days ago.The senior Congress leader announced on Thursday, April 7, that even though KPCC President K Sudhakaran had warned a couple of days ago that Thomas would have to face disciplinary action if he attended the event, he would take part in the event.With the high command issuing a directive to not take part in the event, leaders like Shashi Tharoor and Ramesh Chennithala had withdrawn from the event. The All-India Congress Committee (AICC) might agree with the KPCC's opinion.However, that depends on what the leader will speak at the meeting. It is also possible that AICC may leave the decision to the KPCC on how to deal with KV Thomas.
Author: Rickson Oommen

Headline: Pathankot: 3 killed, 1 injured after bike collides with tractor-trolley
Entire_News: Three people, including a child, were killed while one sustained injuries when a speeding bike collided with a tractor-trolley on Defence Road, Pathankot, on Thursday.Four people were riding the motorcycle. Three of the four people died on the spot in the road accident.The injured woman was admitted to the Civil Hospital where she was undergoing treatment and was said to be in a stable condition.The trolley driver fled the spot. A case was registered and efforts are underway to arrest the driver.READ MORE: Bathinda: One critically injured in clash between two groupsREAD MORE: Delhi Police nabs man with stolen scooty in Roop Nagar area; pistol recovered
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Religious leader issues rape threat as crowd cheers in UP’s Sitapur, probe ordered
Entire_News: In a video that has emerged on social media, a religious leader can purportedly be heard threatening to kidnap and rape women of a particular community. He was addressing a gathering in Sitapur district in Uttar Pradesh.The video was shot on April 2. The Uttar Pradesh police have now ordered a probe and said that legal action will be taken on the basis of the facts and evidence collected.In the video, a man in saffron robes is addressing a gathering from inside a vehicle. He is reportedly a mahant in a town called Khairabad and has been identified as ‘Bajrang Muni’.Speaking into a microphone, he can be heard saying in Hindi, “If a man harasses any girl in the area, I will pick up your daughters from your homes and rape them.”His statement was met with cheers from the crowd.After the video went viral on social media, the Sitapur Police tweeted, “Investigation by Additional Superintendent of Police is in progress. Legal action will be taken as per rules on the basis of the facts and evidence.”(With inputs from Arvind Mohan Mishra)
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: NIA likely to file chargesheet in connection with civilian killings in J&K
Entire_News: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) is likely to file a chargesheet against at least two dozen people accused of being involved in the killings that took place in Jammu and Kashmir in October last year. The chargesheet is expected to be submitted before NIA's special court in Patiala House on Friday.At least 11 people from the minority community were killed in October 2021. Many of them were non-locals.An FIR was filed in Delhi in October last year over the incident. It states that in several acts of terror, numerous innocent civilians and security personnel have been killed, unleashing a reign of terror in the Kashmir Valley.The FIR was filed after information was received about the cadres of proscribed terror organization Lashkar E Taiba (LeT), Jaisli-e-Mohammed (JeM), Hizb-ul-Mujahideen (HM), Al Badr and their affiliates such as The Resistance Front (TRF), People Against Fascist Forces (PAFF) Mujahideen Gazwat UL hind (MGH) operating in Jammu and Kashmir."They are conspiring... and in cyberspace. They are planning to undertake violent terrorist acts in Jammu and Kashmir and major cities of India, including one in New Delhi," the FIR said."They are in cohorts with their Pakistan-based handlers and commanders along with their network of Over Ground Workers (OGWs)," the FIR said.The FIR said that their modus operandi included radicalization of "...local youth for" the purpose of recruiting and training them in the handling of arms, ammunition and explosives.Top sources told India Today, "This has been a painstaking investigation. This is the first such case at the national level on the Hybrid module, where several of the accused are people who otherwise are the 'aam aadmi' or the common man."But several of them, including a student who would be part of the ecosystem... would pick up the gun, do the killing and go on to live their normal lives," sources said.An officer in J&K said, "Even though the Jammu and Kashmir Police has filed chargesheets, the chargesheet by the NIA will be significant in pinning down the role of such terror organisations."Earlier this March, terrorists shot dead a civilian and injured a non-local labourer in Budgam and Pulwama districts in two separate incidents in Jammu and Kashmir.An officer said that it had been anticipated that violence would escalate, especially in the wake of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit. He also suspected a desperate attempt by Pakistan-backed terror organisations to instil fear in the valley.
Author: Kamaljit Kaur Sandhu

Headline: Bathinda: One critically injured in clash between two groups
Entire_News: A man was critically injured after a clash broke out between two groups in the main market behind the Bathinda bus stand on Thursday evening.The incident took place at around 10 pm, when, during an argument, two groups of people started pelting stones and thrashing each other with sticks.During the scuffle, one of the men was thrashed brutally.The shopkeepers rescued him and he was admitted to a government hospital for treatment where his condition is said to be critical.The entire incident was recorded on CCTV. A case was registered and an investigation into this matter has been initiated.READ MORE: Noida authority builds theme-based zebra crossings in several areas | Details hereREAD MORE: Gujarat: Mercury rises to 45 degrees Celsius in Kutch’s Kandla; heatwave likely till April 10
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Calcutta HC asks CBI to probe TMC leader's murder that preceded Birbhum violence
Entire_News: The Calcutta High Court handed over the probe of the murder of Trinamool Congress leader in West Bengal’s Birbhum, Bhadu Sheikh, to the Central Bureau of Investigation. Sheikh’s murder was followed by arson in Bogtui village, Rampurhat, Birbhum, that killed nine people, including two children.Bhadu Sheikh was the deputy panchayat pradhan of Bogtui village. He was killed when unidentified assailants hurled crude bombs at his house in Rampurhat on March 21. So far, his murder was being investigated by the Birbhum police.
Author: Suryagni Roy

Headline: Madhya Pradesh Police's answer to lock-up suicides: Strip accused
Entire_News: After facing massive backlash over a photo of a journalist and a few activists locked up and stripped to their underwear at a Madhya Pradesh police station, the SHO tried to explain that this was for the “accused's safety”. He said that the lock-up accused were stripped of their clothes so that they don’t commit suicide.
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Sri Lankan family returns to Tamil Nadu as refugees after 12 years
Entire_News: A family of four, including a 2-year-old child, reached Tamil Nadu from Sri Lanka on Friday, April 8. The severe economic crisis has forced another family from Sri Lanka to come to India as refugees.Kishanthan and his wife, Ranjitha, along with their two children, a 10-year-old girl and 2-year-old boy, reached Danushkodi in the wee hours of Friday morning. The family was taken into custody by the Mandapam police in Rameshwaram.Ranjitha and Kishanthan used to live as refugees in India during the Sri Lankan civil war. Ranjitha was at the Krishnagiri refugee camp and Kishanthan was at the Pudukottai refugee camp. In 2010, post their marriage, they returned to Sri Lanka as the civil war had come to an end.But now, the unprecedented economic crisis has forced the family to once again return as refugees.“10 litres of diesel is being provided every alternative day. But that is not sufficient for the fishing boats that I was working in. Then I tried to work as a mason but there was a shortage of cement, and most industries have been affected because of the power shortage. So there is no work, no money and no food," said Kishanthan."We have a family in Krishnagiri and want to go to them. We were refugees here before, and now again the situation in Sri Lanka is very bad. We have come to Tamil Nadu with the belief that we will get a home here,” added Ranjitha.Kishanthan (34), Ranjita (29), Genestica (10) and Akash, landed at Dhanushkodi’s Arichalmunai beach in a fibre boat from the Mannar area in Sri Lanka at around 2 am.The Amandapam police are now conducting a preliminary investigation with the family. After the investigation is complete, they will be moved to the Mandapam refugee camp.Last month, 16 Sri Lankan Tamils came to Danushkodi and Rameshwaram. They were detained at the Mandapam refugee camp.The Indian coast guard has advised officials to intensify surveillance along the international maritime border, as Sri Lankan Tamils are likely to come to India as refugees due to the sharp rise in food and essential commodities and shortage of essential commodities in Sri Lanka.Also Read: As Sri Lankan economic crisis deepens, officials say 2,000 to 4,000 refugees may land in Tamil Nadu
Author: Akshaya Nath

Headline: Gujarat: Mercury rises to 45 degrees Celsius in Kutch’s Kandla; heatwave likely till April 10
Entire_News: As heatwave conditions continue to grip parts of Gujarat, the Kandla airport in the Kutch district on Thursday registered the maximum temperature of 45 degrees Celsius, said the Meteorological Centre.The maximum temperature crossed the 40 degrees Celsius mark at several locations, including Surendranagar (44.4 degrees Celsius), Bhuj (43.4), Keshod (43.7), Amreli (43.4), Deesa (43.4), Ahmedabad (43.2), Rajkot (43.1) and Gandhinagar (43).As per the prediction by the MeT officials, heatwave conditions would prevail in different parts of the state till April 11 including Kutch, Banaskantha, Gandhinagar, Ahmedabad, Patan, Porbandar, Rajkot, Surendranagar and Amreli.Citing no respite from the heatwave conditions in the days ahead, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said, "Heat wave spell is likely to continue over Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, south Punjab, south Haryana-Delhi, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar and Jharkhand during the next 5 days and over northern parts of Gujarat during the next 3 days" (sic)Heat Wave Spell likely to continue over Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, south Punjab, south Haryana-Delhi, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar and Jharkhand during next 5 days and over norther parts of Gujarat during next 3 daysREAD MORE| Ahmedabad: Temperature likely to touch 42 degrees Celsius; heat wave to continue
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: UP Board paper leak 2022: School principal among six arrested for helping students cheat in exams in Ghazipur
Entire_News: The Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force (STF) has arrested six people for allegedly helping students cheat in the Class 10 and 12 Board examinations in Ghaziabad district. A principal, a teacher and other staff members from Saidpur were accused of demanding bribes worth Rs 25,000 from students appearing for the examinations to give them pass marks.Acting on a tip-off, the STF conducted a raid at Panchayat Bhawan adjacent to Inter college and arrested three people from the spot. Students appearing for the exams and other administrators were also taken into police custody. Varanasi STF Chief Punit Singh Parihar received specific inputs that students were giving open book exams for Physics papers, following which a raid was carried out in the evening at 4 pm.The sleuths arrested three students identified as Ravi, Shailendra and Rajnish Kushwaha and upon further interrogation, administrators Ravindranath Rai, clerks Ashok Kumar and Piyush were also apprehended.The accused were taken into police custody for questioning and a case under appropriate sections of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) was registered later.The incident comes close on the heels after UP Board's Class 12 paper was leaked in Ballia, triggering a crackdown on the copying syndicate. The manager of two schools, a teacher and three staff were accused of opening the tamper-proof packet containing the exam paper and leaking it.The Class 12 English exam of the state Board was leaked on March 30 from the Ballia district in Uttar Pradesh, following which the exam was cancelled in 24 districts. The exam is now scheduled to be held on April 13. The paper was leaked from Maharaja Devi Inter College of Bhimpura police station area in Ballia.
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Aakar Patel to move court against CBI for not revoking look out circular despite order
Entire_News: Ex-Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel will move a contempt petition against the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) officials for keeping the look out circular against him open despite orders passed by a Delhi court to withdraw the same. The hearing is likely to be at 10 am at a Delhi court.This comes after Aakar Patel said he was stopped from flying abroad despite a go-ahead to fly from a Delhi court.In a tweet on Thursday evening, Patel claimed that the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has not yet taken him off their LOC as he was again stopped from boarding his flight abroad by immigration officials at Bengaluru airport.Patel further tweeted that he will “Move court again tomorrow if I have to.”The CBI has also moved the sessions court challenging the trial court order from yesterday that set aside the look out circular against Aakar Patel and asked the CBI director to issue an apology to Patel.On Thursday, Delhi's Rouse Avenue court ordered the CBI to withdraw the LOC issued against Aakar Patel and allow him to travel to the US. In its order, the court also asked the Director of the CBI to issue a written apology "acknowledging lapse on the part of his subordinate".On April 6, Aakar Patel alleged that he was stopped at Bengaluru airport and not allowed to go to the US after the CBI put him on the exit control list.Patel reasoned that the move was a result of the Enforcement Directorate’s money laundering case against Amnesty International India. The ED case was based on an FIR filed by the CBI in connection with the alleged violation of the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) and Section 120B of the Indian Penal Code (criminal conspiracy).
Author: Aneesha Mathur

Headline: Following AIADMK’s move, BJP in Chennai to protest DMK govt’s property tax hike
Entire_News: After the AIADMK, its alliance partner, BJP, is scheduled to hold an agitation in Chennai, protesting the rise in property tax across the state. The AIADMK held a state-wide protest against the move earlier this week.The protest is likely to happen around 11 am. BJP's state general secretary, Karu Nagaraj, will be the one leading the protest.AIADMK had demanded the roll back of the new property tax. AIADMK senior leader, O Panneerselvam, on April 5, said that the new property tax had hit the people of TN like a Tsunami wave."This will affect the common man and has struck the people like a tsunami wave. We will continue our protest against this. We are seeing a situation where the people of the state will take the streets to demand their rights," said OPS.AIADMK MLAs, who raised the issue in the Tamil Nadu Assembly, staged a walkout on April 6, claiming that they were not satisfied with the concerned minister’s reply.Even DMK’s allies, the Congress and Communist party MLAs have urged the government to reduce the tax.The property tax hike ranges between 25 percent to 150 percent. The state had cited the 15th finance commission recommendation, and the condition that they would be denied funds if the taxes were not increased, as the reason for the property tax rise.While KN Nehru, the Municipal corporation minister, reasoned that the rise would not affect the common man and the poor, the AIADMK, the Opposition party, has condemned the move.Also Read: Tamil Nadu govt hikes property tax, Palaniswami calls it 'gift by DMK' for recent poll win
Author: Akshaya Nath

Headline: Leopard enters residential area in Pune district, scuffles with pet dog | Video
Entire_News: A leopard entered a residential area in Shirur in Maharashtra's Pune district. The leopard entered the courtyard of the home of a person named Mahesh Patil in Karandi village.As it entered, the pet dog in the house began barking and the two animals got into a brief scuffle. After the dog ran away, the leopard too exited.The entire incident was caught by a CCTV camera.In another incident, about two weeks ago, a leopard entered the residence of a BJP leader in Srinagar. The leader, Ashok Koul, was taking a walk when the leopard suddenly appeared in the lawn. He escaped narrowly.(With inputs from Smita Shinde)
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Earth Day: Agra citizens vow to plant 100 trees each in their lifetime
Entire_News: There's no denying the fact that the world we live in needs more trees. Along with the wave of development, the trees are getting fewer day by day, especially in urban areas.Taking a step forward towards preserving the greenery, the citizens of Agra have decided to replace the loss of each tree by planting more. On Earth Day, they promised to plant 100 trees in their lifetime.Speaking on the matter, Squadron Leader (Retd.) A K Singh told India Today that 1000 trees are chopped down every day to make paper napkins.READ| Delhi's temperature rises to 42.8 degrees Celsius, no respite in sight"The cutting down of these trees and the use of plastic are together the cause of global warming, as plastic decomposes in centuries. The kind of heat India is experiencing in March-April is indicative of the level of global warming. If every citizen plants at least 100 trees in his lifetime, future generations will be able to live in a better atmosphere than today," he said.Talking about the rise of skin diseases in the youth, Hindustani Biradari Vice-Chairman Vishal Sharma said that the lack of green cover is giving rise to an increased number of skin cancer cases in the younger generation.He added that the pesticides used in agriculture and chemicals used in pesticides are causing various other types of cancers in the younger generation. Sharma revealed that he has planted a lot of fruit trees in his garden which benefits not just his family, but his neighbours as well.He also said everyone must follow bathroom ethics and use the wastewater for watering plants.Social activist Sameer pointed out that every year, thousands of trees are planted all over Agra during plantation drives, but nobody cares for them after that.As a result, those trees fail to survive till next year. If the trees are taken care of in the first year, the city could restore its green cover within the next few years.READ| Arvind Kejriwal-led govt brings e-cycles under EV policy in Delhi, to provide subsidy upto Rs 15,000
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Andhra Pradesh hospitals go dark, baby delivered using cellphone light, candles | Videos
Entire_News: Hospitals across multiple parts of Andhra Pradesh reported loss of power on Thursday night, April 7. Babies were delivered by light from cellphones, torches and candles.With no electricity at NTR government hospital at Narsipatnam for hours, doctors had to perform delivery under cell phone lights and candles.Similarly, darkness due to power cuts prevailed in PG Jangareddygudem area Hospital and patients had to suffer for hours. There was no electricity in the maternity ward, while hospital staff said that there was no diesel in the generator. So, the hospital remained in darkness for almost the entire night.The Andhra Pradesh State power transmission corporation has announced a 50% industrial power cut to meet the rising power demand amid sweltering heat.The industrial load relief will continue for 15 days. While power demand has increased, the state is facing a deficit of around 5 lakh units per day of power after using all its resources.The opposition, Telugu Desam Party (TDP), which is already protesting the power price increase, has now taken up the power cut issue.Party President and former Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu blamed the YS Jagan Mohan Reddy Government for 'a hellish time' due to long hours of unscheduled power cuts.In a tweet, the TDP chief expressed concern over the people in villages suffering on account of severe interruptions in power supply without prior information.“A state which once illuminated with abundant power, was now pushed into darkness and blackouts,” he said.Naidu demanded that Chief Minister YS Jagan give answers to the pregnant and lactating women who were suffering a lot in maternity hospitals.He also demanded the Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party (YSRCP) government to explain to the general public as to why the state was facing frequent and long power cuts.“Why is the government implementing power cuts though the people were paying huge current bills without fail?” he further said.Chandrababu Naidu advised the government to stop threatening the public who were raising their voice against its unscheduled power cuts and solve the issue.Also Read: TRS MLA snatches mike from party MP during protest in Telangana’s Mahabubabad | Video
Author: Ashish Pandey

Headline: TRS MLA snatches mike from party MP during protest in Telangana’s Mahabubabad | Video
Entire_News: An ugly spat broke out between ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) party leaders, with an MLA snatching the microphone from an MP during a protest in Mahabubabad.TRS MLA Banoth Shankar Nayak of Mahabubabad snatched the microphone from his own party MP, Maloth Kavita, during a protest. The entire incident took place during a protest organised against the BJP-led union government on Thursday, April 7.The differences between Shankar Nayak representing Mahabubabad constituency and MP M Kavitha representing Mahabubabad parliament constituency came out in the open when party leaders were participating in a dharna demanding that the union government procure the entire paddy of the state’s farmers.As instructed by the party chief and CM K Chandrashekar Rao, the protest was organised at district headquarters.When TRS MP Kavitha was addressing the gathering, TRS MLA Shankar Naik stood at the stage and snatched the microphone from the MP, saying he would speak.Also Read: Procure every grain of paddy from Telangana farmers, says CM KCR’s daughter to CentreThis stunned all other leaders and workers present at the venue. A humiliated Kavitha later took part in the dharna but has complained to senior leadership about the behaviour of the MLA.In 2017, Nayak was arrested for misbehaving with the then woman district collector.The issue was brought to the knowledge of CM KCR by the IAS Association, following which the MLA was booked under Section 353 (assault or criminal force to deter a public servant from discharge of his duty), 354 (Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty) and 509 (word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman).Also Read: BJP MP Bandi Sanjay says CM KCR is running Telangana in drunken state after police raid on rave party
Author: Ashish Pandey

Headline: Maharashtra govt starts using blockchain technology for caste certificate validation
Entire_News: The Maharashtra government on Thursday started using a system based on the blockchain technology for caste certificate validation.Caste certificate validation currently involves a lot of manual intervention and is prone to frauds and forgery, officials said.Fraudulent caste certificates can deprive eligible persons of job or education opportunities.
Author: Press Trust of India

Headline: Vontimitta temple in Andhra Pradesh's Kadapa district gears up for annual fete
Entire_News: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) is organising the grand Ankurarpanam fete on the evening of April 9 for the annual Sri Ramanavami Brahmotsavam of Sri Kodandaramaswami temple at Vontimitta. The festivities will be held from April 10 to 18 in Kadapa district.The spectacular ceremony of Dwajarohanam will be conducted at Vrishabha lagna between 8am and 9am. On the same evening, Potana Jayanti and Kavi Sammelanam followed by Sesha Vahana Seva will be observed.The TTD is organising daily vahanas sevas, cultural and dharmic programs like Harikathas, discourses, Sahiti sadassu, Sankeetans by bhajan mandalis and Kolatas in front of vahana sevas by artists of the Hindu Dharma Prachara Parishad (HDPP), and other projects on these days.Meanwhile, the footfall of devotees at the world's richest Hindu shrine, Tirumala Tirupati Temple is back to normalcy. As many as 19.72 lakh devotees offered prayers at the hill shrine in March and the temple received a whopping Rs 128 crore in its ‘Hundi’ (offering box).Hair donations were offered by 9.54 lakh devotees and 24.10 lakh devotees were provided Anna Prasadam, while 1.04 crore laddus were bought by devotees.Also Read: Bengali author Amar Mitra awarded O. Henry prize for 45 year old storyAlso Read: Maharashtra government initiates chapter proceeding against BJP MLA Nitesh Rane
Author: Ashish Pandey

Headline: Odisha beefs up security at Puri Temple after kitchen vandalisation
Entire_News: A day after the arrest of a man on charges of vandalizing the earthen ovens inside the kitchen at Lord Jagannath Temple here, the Puri district administration on Thursday beefed up security at the 12th century shrine, a senior official said.Puri district collector Samarth Verma, who is also the deputy chief administrator of Shree Jagannath Temple Administration (SJTA), said the district police will be deployed inside the temple along with the Jagannth Temple Police (JTP) from Thursday night.Verma said this after a meeting of the officials of district administration, SJTA, police department and hereditary servicers. He said the discussion was held on augmenting security in the temple as many participants pointed out that the `Chullha’ vandalisation incident has exposed lacunae in the existing security arrangement.It was decided at the meeting that all officials of the police, district and temple administration will have a coordination meeting every week instead of once a month.
Author: Press Trust of India

Headline: Delhi govt collected Rs 28,573 crore as GST and VAT in 2021-22: Officials
Entire_News: Recovering gradually from the impact of the Covid pandemic, the Delhi government has managed to collect Rs 28,573 crore as GST and VAT in 2021-22 that is over 35 percent higher as compared to the last fiscal, officials said on Thursday.The goods and services tax (GST) and value added tax (VAT) collection of Delhi in 2020-21 was Rs 18,572 crore due to the disruption of economic activities caused by Covid-related restrictions, they said.In comparison to 2019-20, the GST and VAT collection in 2020-21 had registered a negative growth of 19.53 per cent. The government had collected Rs 25,715 crore as GST and VAT in 2019-20, said a tax official.“The growth in GST and VAT is indicative of recovery and a sign that the collection target in 2022-23 will be achieved,” he said.
Author: Press Trust of India

Headline: Bengaluru man sets son ablaze for failing to run business properly
Entire_News: A 55-year-old man was arrested in Bengaluru for setting his son on fire after an argument broke out about their business. The incident happened on April 1 in Valmiki Nagar, Chamarajpet.The accused, Surendra Kumar, set his son, Arpit Setia, ablaze, as the latter had taken over his father’s paint fabrication business three years ago and was unable to run it properly.The Times of India reported that Arpit had borrowed more than Rs 1.5 crore apart from the rent he got from a building he had off Mysuru road.Worried that he might be running the business into the ground, Surendra asked his son to show him the accounts of the business and Arpit declined to do so. This led to an argument between the two.Neighbours reportedly said that the two were in a shouting match for 30 minutes inside the godown. Then, Aprit came out of the godown, drenched in some liquid, which was captured by the CCTV camera in the area. A report by NDTV stated that Arpit was covered in paint thinner, a spirit-based solvent.IndiaToday.in isn't using the CCTV footage of the incident for its sensitive content.The CCTV footage further showed Surendra coming out after his son. Arpit could be seen pleading with his father, but the man was in no mood to listen.When his father lit a matchstick, Arpit can be seen trying to stop his father. However, the flame got snuffed out. Surendra then lit another matchstick and threw it at Arpit, who was soon engulfed in flames.CCTV visuals show the 25-year-old son running around screaming that his father had set him on fire. Locals in the area doused Arpit and took him to Victoria Hospital by auto, where doctors said he had suffered 60% burns.He succumbed to his injuries on Thursday, April 7. Preliminary investigations by the police said that the father and son had been fighting for almost a year.Based on three eyewitnesses, the Bengaluru police registered a case of murder against Surendra for setting his 25-year-old son ablaze. Deputy Commissioner of Police, (West) Sanjeev M Patil, said that the father had been arrested for murder.Further probe is on.Also Read: Delhi: Miscreants enter girl's house, brutally thrash family members with iron rodsAlso Read: Haryana man kills daughter for chatting over phone for long hours
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Gujarat minister Vaghani clarifies his remarks over education after AAP, Cong criticism
Entire_News: Facing flak for his remarks about the education system in Gujarat, minister Jitu Vaghani on Thursday said he has respect for the state and its people, and asserted his comments were targeted at those who want to spread “anarchy and disorder”.Vaghani had on Wednesday courted controversy after he said those who have problems with the education system of Gujarat can take leaving certificates of their wards and go to other states. The BJP minister holds the education portfolio.The opposition Congress and the AAP had strongly criticized the BJP minister over his comments and Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, who also holds the education portfolio, on Thursday tweeted about the remarks after which Vaghani issued a clarification.
Author: Press Trust of India

Headline: Centre’s monthly review: Current crude price level may affect India’s economic growth rate
Entire_News: The finance ministry's monthly economic review for March warned that the present level of international crude price may hinder the growth of India’s economy. According to the ministry, if the current level of crude price persists for a long time, it may come in the way of India achieving an economic growth rate north of 8 per cent in the coming financial year.Further, if the conflict between Russia and Ukraine remains unresolved, there will be a 1 percent negative impact on the world output growth.As per the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development(OECD), the negative impact on global output growth would aggravate the already elevated consumer inflation rate by 2.5 per cent.The ongoing conflict is also accentuating some of the trends already underway, such as global food shortages.
Author: Rahul Shrivastava

Headline: Bengali author Amar Mitra awarded O. Henry prize for 45 year old story
Entire_News: Bengali author Amar Mitra was awarded with this year’s O.Henry prize for a short story he wrote 45 years back. The short story titled 'Gaonburo' is a Bengali short fiction written in 1977.Mitra was born in Kolkata and is a well known writer of Bengali literature. He spent some of his childhood in districts of Bengal where he came across the Adivasi culture and their struggle. This is the background to Mitra’s award-winning story.While talking to India Today, Mitra said, "it's a wonderful moment for me. When I wrote this story I didn't know this could happen. But I believe the story has some 'force' in it, which is why a Mexican writer who is younger than me loved this story. An American editor liked it too."
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Agriculture subsidy amounting to Rs 6.81 crore pocketed by two brothers, arrested
Entire_News: The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of the Odisha Crime Branch arrested two brothers on Thursday for misappropriating government subsidies amounting upto Rs 6.81 crore. The subsidy amount was meant for farmers and other beneficiaries.The accused brothers are Manas Ranjan Dash, Director of Sheetal Agro Inputs Pvt Ltd, and Tapas Kumar Dash, proprietor of Mishita Enterprises. Their companies are located in Purohitpur, Taradapada and Jagatsinghpur.The subsidy amount was meant for farmers for the supply of agricultural equipment.
Author: Mohammad Suffian

Headline: Stopped again from flying abroad despite court order, claims Aakar Patel
Entire_News: Former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel has claimed that he was again stopped from flying abroad despite a Delhi court issuing an order to withdraw the Look Out Circular (LOC) issued against him.In a tweet on Thursday evening, Patel claimed that the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has not yet taken him off their LOC as he was again stopped from boarding his flight abroad by immigration officials at Bengaluru airport.Patel further tweeted that he will “move court again tomorrow if I have to.”have been stopped at immigration again. cbi has not taken me off their look out circularOn Thursday, Delhi's Rouse Avenue court ordered the CBI to withdraw the LOC issued against Aakar Patel and allow him to travel to the US. In its order, the court also asked the Director of the CBI to issue a written apology "acknowledging lapse on the part of his subordinate".On April 6, Aakar Patel alleged that he was stopped at Bengaluru airport and not allowed to go to the US after the CBI put him on the exit control list.Patel reasoned that the move was a result of the Enforcement Directorate’s money laundering case against Amnesty International India. The ED case was based on an FIR filed by the CBI in connection with the alleged violation of the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) and Section 120B of the Indian Penal Code (criminal conspiracy).Aakar Patel said that a court in Gujarat had granted him permission to travel abroad. According to Patel, he needs to travel to the US to take up "foreign assignments" and "lecture series" organised by various universities till May 30.Also Read | CBI failed to inform about look-out circular, Aakar Patel's lawyer argues in Delhi court
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Bombay HC imposes cost of improving Taloja prison library on 2 petitioners
Entire_News: The Bombay High Court has ordered two petitioners to pay Rs 5,000 and Rs 10,000 each as costs while hearing their civil petitions. The court specified that the money will be used to buy books for the Taloja central prison's library.The petitions had no relation to the Taloja central prison in Navi Mumbai.The court’s interest towards the state of the prison library started during an earlier hearing of Elgar Parishad accused Gautam Navlakha's plea. He had approached the court to allow a PG Wodehouse book inside the prison.
Author: Vidya

Headline: Sensex tanks over 500 points, Nifty ends at 17,639.55
Entire_News: The Sensex and Nifty fell for a third straight session on Thursday as hawkish signals from the US Federal Reserve to tackle surging inflation slammed investor sentiment in the run-up to a monetary policy decision at home.The NSE Nifty 50 index declined 0.94 per cent or 168.10 points to 17,639.55, and the S&P BSE Sensex fell 0.97 per cent or 575.46 points to 59,034.95.Minutes of the Fed's March meeting released on Wednesday showed deepening concern among policymakers that inflation had broadened through the economy and the need for tighter monetary policy."The Fed minutes are impacting global markets and bond yields are rising. The Russia-Ukraine issue is not fully settled. Globally, costs are rising," said Anita Gandhi, a whole-time director at Arihant Capital Markets.Focus domestically is on the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) policy stance as inflation, especially in food, has been accelerated by the Ukraine conflict, Gandhi said.Despite the price pressures, the central bank is on Friday expected to delay its first interest rate hike by at least four months to August at the earliest, according to a Reuters poll of economists.Inflation is forecast to remain high above the RBI's 4 per cent medium-term target and economists in the Reuters poll said the central bank must now start worrying about the trend, especially with global peers already rising rates to counter the price surge.The Nifty energy index fell 1.7 per cent and the IT index dropped 1.3 per cent to be among the top losers in sectoral indexes.HDFC Bank and Housing Development Finance Corp were among the top losers in the blue-chip Nifty, falling 2.9 per cent and 2.2 per cent, respectively. Both the stocks have in the past three sessions erased all the gains made on Monday after an announcement on their merger.
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: LIC IPO: Date, price details, size for policyholders, investors
Entire_News: The government is unlikely to decrease its stake further in the Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) of India, according to an ANI report. This comes as the wait for the initial public offering (IPO) of LIC gets longer.The government was aiming to raise around Rs 60,000 crore by selling its 5 per cent stake.Top LIC officials said that the government does not have any plan to dilute its stake in the country's largest insurer further, as per the ANI report. LIC officials said that the insurance behemoth won't require funding support from the government for the next two years, the ANI report says.LIC, which was to be launched in March, got delayed due to the volatile situation in the stock market after Russia invaded Ukraine.Earlier, Reuters reported that LIC IPO may launch by mid-April. Now there are reports that the much-awaited IPO is likely to be held in early May if the stock market remains stable.According to norms, if the IPO does not place by May 12, then the government will require to update Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP).According to the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP), LIC's embedded value, which is a measure of the consolidated shareholders value in an insurance company, has been pegged at about Rs 5.4 lakh crore as of September 30, 2021, by international actuarial firm Milliman Advisors.Although the DRHP does not disclose the market valuation of LIC, as per industry standards, it would be about three times the embedded value or around Rs 16 lakh crore, according to a PTI report.The LIC public issue would be the biggest IPO in the history of the Indian stock market. Once listed, LIC's market valuation would be comparable to top companies like RIL and TCS, the PTI report says.So far, the amount mobilised from IPO of Paytm in 2021 was the largest ever at Rs 18,300 crore, followed by Coal India (2010) at nearly Rs 15,500 crore and Reliance Power (2008) at Rs 11,700 crore.policyholders must link PAN details with their LIC policies to become eligible to participate in the upcoming LIC's IPO and get a discount over the floor price.
Author: India Today Web Desk

Headline: Jet Airways 2.0: From launch date to benefits for flyers, CEO Sanjiv Kapoor reveals key details
Entire_News: Jet Airways is gearing up to take to Indian skies by October 2022, airline Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Sanjiv Kapoor said. The Kalrock-Jalan consortium, the winning bidder for bankrupt Jet Airways, is also planning two-class facilities for flyers, according to reports.The resumption of services will come after a hiatus of more than three years. Jet Airways stopped services in April 2019 after being bogged down by financial woes.Newly appointed CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said that Jet Airways will offer two-class facilities for flyers as part of the airline's plan to return with a hybrid of no-frills and premium services.There will be a business class under which flyers will be offered free meals and other premium services.There will also be low-cost economy class, Kapoor said. In the economy class, passengers will have to pay for on-board meals, he said.
